concept.title: Configuring the resource adapter for outbound communication when you use queues in a cluster
concept.shortdesc: When you use queues with the resource adapter in a cluster, you must consider the values that are assigned to the connection factory properties.

conbody.p: Do not configure a clientId in this scenario as JMS allows only one connection per clientId. In this scenario, as multiple application servers are used and therefore multiple connections are made, a clientId cannot be used.

section.title: Configuring the resource adapter properties in cluster for outbound communication

dd.p:
You must set the following connection factory properties for queues when you configure the resource adapter for outbound communication in a cluster:
server The host name or IP address. You must specify the host name or IP address of the endpoint that you configured.
port The port of the endpoint that you configured.
traceLevel The level of trace detail that is provided in the JMS and resource adapter output for this connection. Higher log levels can result in a large amount of trace output and can affect performance. Use trace levels of 5 or lower to minimize performance impact and generate a small amount of trace, including stack traces for all exceptions.
